page.title: 20HEDGE REMOVAL NEAR CANTERB'Y
page.content:
{The Removal of Hedgerows} The hedgerows are very useful to animals,insects and birds.Int this part of Kent many have now been removed.Reasons given by the farmers include the following - 1.they are often keen to enlarge their feilds to allow for easier mechanisation 2.They suggest that hedgerows provide a habitat for pests and diseases which might destroy their crops. One common hawthorn hedge was studied and was found to contain some of the following plant and animal life - 1.common garden spider 2.money spider 3.long-tailed fieldmouse 4.blackbird
These are just a few of the animals and plants which are endangered by the cutting down of hedgerows which is sad for us but more especially for the animals that make homes & breed there.
